revised_title: Energy and Momentum in General Relativity: A New Approach to 4-Momentum
tldr: The author presents a new method to derive a class of pseudo-tensor conservation equations in general relativity, including those by Einstein and Landau & Lifshitz. When space-time is asymptotically flat, the conservation equations are cast into tensor form, and invariant integral conservation laws are derived. These laws suggest possible definitions of the 4-momentum of a system in terms of four invariant integrals, which can be used to distinguish between radiating and non-radiating systems. The Landau-Lifshitz conservation equation is considered more useful due to its symmetry, leading to further invariants related to angular momentum.
